fusilli-pollo-vegano.title: Fusilli Pollo Vegano
fusilli-pollo-vegano.intro: Fusilli Pollo Vegano is a modern pasta dish often enjoyed by vegetarians. It combines fusilli pasta with plant-based chicken nuggets, sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, and green pesto. This dish is often served with lamb's lettuce and arugula, and finished with Parmesan cheese. The diverse ingredients make it both nutritious and flavorful.
fusilli-pollo-vegano.content:
- 500 grams of Fusilli or Ghiottole (Ghiottole is a larger/thicker pasta combines better with the large lamb's lettuce leaves)
- 300 grams of vegan chicken nuggets (fried, then sliced into strips)
- Sun-dried tomatoes (cut into strips)
- Pine nuts
- Pesto alle Genovese
- Shavings of Parmigiano Reggiano
- Bag of lamb's lettuce

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Fry the vegan chicken nuggets, then chop into slices
- Mix the pasta with the pesto
- Mix pesto pasta with everything else:
	- Lamb's lettuce
	- Sun-dried tomatoes
	- Sliced vegan chicken nuggets
- Top off with shavings of Parmigiano Reggiano and Pine nuts

pasta-con-crema-di-verza.title: Pasta con Crema di Verza
pasta-con-crema-di-verza.intro: Pasta con Crema di Verza is a pasta dish made with casareccia pasta and a sauce of finely chopped savoy cabbage. The cabbage is cooked and mixed with pesto. It is complemented with vegan chicken, a plant-based alternative to chicken. This dish is often served as a nutritious and flavorful vegetarian meal.
pasta-con-crema-di-verza.content:
- Casareccia
- Savoy cabbage (finely chopped)
- Vegan chicken
- Pesto (alla Genovese or red)
- Optionally add some mayonnaise and thyme

## Steps

- Cook the pasta and the Savoy cabbage in one pot
- Add the Vegan chicken to the pasta at the end, just for heating them up
- Mix with the pesto before serving

## Lombardy

Pasta con Crema di Verza originates from the Lombardy region in Italy. Lombardy is known for its rich and hearty dishes, often using local vegetables and cheeses. This dish uses savoy cabbage, which is abundant in the fall and winter in this region.

piatto-di-pollo-messicano.title: Piatto di Pollo Messicano
piatto-di-pollo-messicano.intro: Piatto di Pollo Messicano is a dish that yields five servings and consists of various layers and ingredients. For the base, 400 grams of vegan chicken strips and raisins are used. The foundation includes 400 grams of penne pasta and two servings of red pesto. The sauce, which is simmered, contains two cans of diced tomatoes, one onion, Red Yucateco sauce, and thyme. Aged grated cheese is used as a topping, baked until golden brown in the oven for 30 minutes at 180°C. This dish combines the spicy flavor of the Mexican Yucateco sauce with the savory notes of Italian herbs and the rich taste of aged cheese.
piatto-di-pollo-messicano.content:
- Penne
- Vegan chicken strips
- Raisins
- Red pesto
- 2 cans of diced tomatoes
- 1 onion
- Red Yucateco
- Thyme
- Aged grated cheese

## Steps

- Base
    - 400 grams of vegan chicken strips
    - Raisins
- Main
    - 400 grams of pasta (penne)
    - 2 jars of red pesto
- Sauce (reduce)
    - 2 cans of diced tomatoes
    - 1 onion
    - Red Yucateco
    - Thyme
- Topping
    - Aged grated cheese
    - 30 minutes at 180°C in the oven until the cheese is golden brown

rigatoni-al-pesto-di-avocado.title: Rigatoni al Pesto di Avocado
rigatoni-al-pesto-di-avocado.intro: Rigatoni al Pesto di Avocado combines a creamy avocado sauce with a fresh pesto flavor. The sauce is made from blended avocado, pesto, quartered tomatoes, cheese, and herbs. The rigatoni is cooked, with spinach added during the last 5 minutes. Everything is mixed together and finished with a topping of basil and almonds. This dish is popular in modern Italian cuisine and is often served as a light, nutritious meal.
rigatoni-al-pesto-di-avocado.content:
- Blend avocado with
	- Pesto
	- Tomatoes, quartered
	- Parmigiano Reggiano (grated)
	- Origano di Burgio
- Cook rigatoni
    - Cook spinach with the pasta for the last 5 minutes
- Mix everything together
- Topping:
    - Basil
    - Almonds

sedanini-carbonara.title: Sedanini Carbonara
sedanini-carbonara.intro: For Pasta Carbonara, it's preferable to use hearty pastas like Rigatoni or Spaghettoni. These pastas have a thicker texture that better holds the creamy sauce, resulting in a richer taste experience. Spaghetti, being a thinner pasta, is less capable of carrying the sauce, which means the texture and flavor of the dish do not fully come into their own. The traditional choice of sturdy pasta ensures that every bite is fully enjoyed with the rich, creamy sauce and the crispy pieces of Guanciale.
sedanini-carbonara.content:
- A hearty pasta (Rigatoni, Spaghettoni, Sedanini)
- Guanciale (or pancetta)
- Parmigiano Reggiano
- Pecorino Romano
- One big egg
- Ground black pepper
- Pasta water

## Step by step

- Cook the pasta (1L per 100gr)
	- Not too much water, since we really want starchy water for binding our sauce
- Fry the Guanciale, and set the Guanciale bits aside (for topping)
    - Do not discard the fat, use it for the sauce
- Pre-mix (can also be done directly in the pan if you're skilled)
    - Parmigiano Reggiano and Pecorino Romano (40g or more per person)
    - About one egg per person. No eggs? Make "Pasta alla Gricia" instead
    - Black pepper (a lot)
    - Pasta cooking water (needed to make a creamy sauce, the more concentrated, the better - you need those starches)
        - Reserve about 1 cup of pasta water - you need this when mixing everything together - or do it the Italian way: fish out the pasta from the water using a slotted spoon or skimmer to keep all the water
- Stir the pasta in the fat from the Guanciale, and add some spoons of pasta water to clean te pan whilst cooking
    - Add the sauce and heat mildly (not too quickly or too long, or it will become scrambled eggs; it should become a creamy sauce - adding cooking water early ensures the eggs don't cook, and the cheese melts into a creamy sauce)
- Serve with Guanciale bits on top (looks nicer than mixed in)
    - Add some extra black pepper (coarsely ground)

## Guanciale

Guanciale is an Italian cured meat made from pork jowl. It is seasoned, air-dried, and has a richer and more intense flavor compared to pancetta, which is often made from pork belly. Guanciale is a popular ingredient in classic Italian dishes such as Pasta Carbonara and Amatriciana. Its unique taste can add a special twist to your pasta experiments!

trofie-al-pesto.title: Trofie / Trenette al Pesto
trofie-al-pesto.intro: A classic dish from Liguria (a region in northwestern Italy), where green beans and potatoes are cooked together with the pasta and mixed with homemade basil pesto. Typical ingredients include fusilli pasta or trenette/linguine, green beans, potatoes, and pesto. If you can find it, using Trofie or Trenette pasta makes the meal even more special.
trofie-al-pesto.content:
- Fusilli pasta, Trofie or Trenette/Linguine
- Green beans
- Potato
- Pesto alla Genovese

## Need help?

[Watch this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AKsdiHfX-0w)

## Trenette

Trenette is a traditional pasta from Liguria, similar to linguine but slightly narrower and often thicker. Both types of pasta have a flat, ribbon-like shape, but trenette is specifically associated with Ligurian cuisine and is often used with pesto, as in the dish Trenette al Pesto.

## Trofie

Trofie is also a traditional pasta from Liguria, known for its twisted, spiral shape. Unlike linguine or trenette, trofie is uniquely suited to holding thick sauces like pesto. This pasta is specifically associated with Ligurian cuisine and is often used in dishes such as Trofie al Pesto, highlighting the region's famous basil pesto.

paccheri-al-pomodoro-e-fontina.title: Paccheri al Pomodoro e Fontina
paccheri-al-pomodoro-e-fontina.intro: Pasta al Pomodoro e Fontina is an Italian dish where Paccheri pasta is combined with a sauce made from diced ripe tomatoes, minced garlic, and fresh basil leaves, all prepared in extra virgin olive oil. The pasta is mixed with grated Fontina cheese, which adds a creamy texture and rich flavor. This dish is often enjoyed in Northern Italy, especially in the Valle d'Aosta region, where Fontina cheese originates and is commonly used in variations of traditional recipes, such as Pasta al Pomodoro.
paccheri-al-pomodoro-e-fontina.content:
- Paccheri or Mezze Maniche
- Fontina cheese
- Tomatoes (preferably snack tomatoes/cherry tomatoes)
- Garlic
- Small onion
- Fresh basil
- Flour

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Cook and puree:
    - Garlic and onion (not too much onion, optionally no onion even)
    - Ripe tomatoes, diced
    - Fresh basil leaves
- Add 1 tablespoon of flour to the tomato puree (prevents cheese from sticking)
- Fontina cheese, grated (75g)

green-bean-peanut-pasta.title: Green Bean Peanut Pasta
green-bean-peanut-pasta.intro:
This recipe outlines a spicy peanut sauce for pasta. Start by briefly sautéing garlic and ginger until fragrant. Then, add peanut butter, along with vinegar and a sweetener like sugar or honey. For heat, you can incorporate red pepper flakes and soy sauce, or use Yucateco hot sauce. Thin the mixture with water or coconut milk to reach the desired consistency.

Briefly cook green beans and prepare the pasta (such as farfalle, busiate, or cavatappi) according to the instructions. Serve the pasta with the green beans and top with crispy fried onions for added crunch.
green-bean-peanut-pasta.content:
- Sauce
    - Mince a clove of garlic + 1 tsp of ginger, sauté for 30 seconds (until fragrant)
    - Add 4 tbsp of peanut butter
    - Add 1 tbsp of vinegar + 1 tsp of sugar
    - Spice level:
        - Add red pepper flakes + 1 tbsp soy sauce (or a pinch of salt)
        - Yucateco (already contains a lot of salt)
    - Add water to desired thickness
- Cooking
    - Green beans for 2-3 minutes
    - Pasta (farfalle, busiate, cavatappi)
- Serve with fried onions

pasta-piselli-porri.title: Pasta Piselli Porri
pasta-piselli-porri.intro: This dish consists of a pasta recipe featuring a creamy pea and mint sauce. The sauce is made by blending or puréeing peas with fresh mint, garlic, lime juice, pecorino, salt, and pepper. The sauce is prepared separately from the pasta and leeks to ensure it evenly coats the pasta without adhering too much to the leeks. The leeks are cooked separately, and the recommended pasta types are Campanelle (also known as Gigli) or Fusilli lunghi, both of which complement the rich texture of the sauce.
pasta-piselli-porri.content:
- Leek
- Peas
- Mint
- Lime juice (half to a whole lime per person)
- Pecorino (40g)
- Parmegiano Reggiano
- Campanelle/Gigli or Fusilli Lunghi

## Steps

- Sauce
	- Peas: Blend or puree with
	    - Mint
	    - Garlic
	    - Lime juice (half to a whole lime per person)
	    - Pecorino (40g), especially because leeks can be a bit mild
	    - Parmegiano Reggiano
	    - Some black pepper to taste
- Cooking (Separately is best so you can mix the sauce with the pasta first; otherwise, the sauce might stick too much to the leeks)
	- Leeks (1 p.p.)
	- Pasta (Campanelle/Gigli or Fusilli Lunghi work well)
- Garnish with almond flakes or pine nuts before serving

radiatori-da-philadelphia.title: Radiatori da Philadelphia
radiatori-da-philadelphia.intro: Radiatori da Philadelphia is a dish consisting of radiatori pasta with a sauce made from sautéed zucchini, sliced cherry tomatoes, and low-fat Philadelphia cream cheese as the base, which can be substituted with hummus for a healthier option. Parmigiano Reggiano is added for extra flavor. The zucchini and tomatoes are mixed into the sauce, ensuring the pasta is fully coated. This dish is particularly popular in urban areas such as Rome, Milan, and Florence, where modern cuisine and fusion dishes are more widely accepted.
radiatori-da-philadelphia.content:
- Radiatori
- Half a zucchini, sautéed in thin small pieces
- Cherry tomatoes (cut into eighths)
- Philadelphia (low fat)
- Oregano di Burgio
- Parmigiano Reggiano

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Slice half a zucchini into 1mm pizza shaped slices
- Fry the zucchini to boil it down a little
- Cut tomatoes into eighths
- Add the tomatoes and boil it down as well with the zucchini
- When the pasta is ready, add the Philadelphia and Oregano di Burgio, and stir
- Mix with the pasta

paccheri-al-pomodoro.title: Paccheri al Pomodoro
paccheri-al-pomodoro.intro: Pasta al Pomodoro is a traditional Italian dish consisting of pasta served with a sauce made from fresh tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, basil, and sometimes onion. This dish emphasizes the simplicity and quality of the ingredients and is often eaten throughout Italy, especially during the summer when tomatoes are at their best. It holds an important place in Italian cuisine due to its easy preparation and flavorful result.
paccheri-al-pomodoro.content:
- Paccheri or Mezze Maniche
- 250 gr tomatoes, diced (preferably snack tomatoes/cherry tomatoes)
- Garlic
- Small onion
- Fresh basil (teared into small pieces - don't use a knife, since most flavor will go into your cutting board instead of into your dish)

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Fry the garlic and onion (not too much onion, optionally no onion even)
- Add the tomatoes, and let it boil down a little
- Mash the tomatoes
- Add the pasta and fresh basil leaves

mezze-maniche-alla-valle-d-aosta.title: Mezze Maniche alla Valle d'Aosta
mezze-maniche-alla-valle-d-aosta.intro: Mezze Maniche alla Valle d'Aosta is a dish from the Italian region of Valle d'Aosta. This region, located in the northwestern Alps, is known for its culinary traditions rich in dairy products. The dish is made with Mezze Maniche pasta (literally: "short sleeves"), ham cubes, butter, Fontina cheese, and cooking cream (panna). The ham is heated with the butter, then the Fontina and cream are added. Everything is mixed well until the sauce comes together and completely coats the pasta. Fontina, a semi-hard cheese, is one of the most famous products from Valle d'Aosta and gives this dish its characteristic flavor.
mezze-maniche-alla-valle-d-aosta.content:
- Mezze Maniche pasta
- 75 grams of ham cubes
- 75 grams of Fontina cheese (cut into pieces)
- 100 ml of cream (panna)

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Warm up the Fontina cheese with cooking cream
- Add the ham cubes
- If it gets dry, add some pasta water (no need to extra cooking cream)
- Mix in the pasta

## Need help?

[Watch this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xplRLCgHwtM)

linguine-spinaci-e-ricotta.title: Linguine Spinaci e Ricotta
linguine-spinaci-e-ricotta.intro: Linguine Spinaci e Ricotta is a pasta dish with spinach and a sauce made from ricotta, lemon zest, and Parmigiano Reggiano. The spinach is briefly sautéed with garlic. The pasta cooking water is used to bind the sauce and give it a creamy texture. This dish combines fresh and savory flavors, popular in Southern Italian cuisine, particularly in the regions of Lazio, Campania, and Puglia.
linguine-spinaci-e-ricotta.content:
- Linguine
- Crushed garlic (briefly fried in oil, then removed)
- 200gr chopped spinach (wilted in oil)
- Ricotta cheese mixed with Parmigiano Reggiano

## Steps

- Cook the pasta
- Fry some pine nuts
- Fry the crushed garlic, and remove from pan (you can leave it in, if you really like garlic)
	- Add the chopped spinach
- When boiled down, turn the heat to lowest mode, and add the ricotta cheese mixed with Parmigiano Reggiano
- Take the Linguine from the pan, and stir into the spinach
- Top off with Parmigiano Reggiano and fried pine nuts

almkse-pasta.title: Almkäse Pasta
almkse-pasta.intro: Almkäse pasta is a dish that highlights Sextner Almkäse, a mountain cheese from the Sesto region in South Tyrol, Italy. This cheese is produced in high-altitude pastures, imparting a distinct flavor due to the local flora. The recipe pairs the cheese with spinach, garlic, walnuts, and a touch of lemon juice for balance. Traditionally, it can be made with various pasta shapes such as fusilli, trofie, pappardelle, or paccheri. The dish reflects alpine and Italian culinary traditions, particularly from regions known for dairy farming and mountain produce.
almkse-pasta.content:
- 50g Sextner Almkäse (Alpine cheese), grated
- 200g spinach
- 1 clove garlic, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 25g walnuts, roughly chopped
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- Salt and pepper to taste
- A pinch of nutmeg
- A handful of cherry tomatoes, halved

## Pasta Types

- Fusilli, Trofie, Pappardelle, or Paccheri

broccoli-bucatini.title: Broccoli Bucatini
broccoli-bucatini.intro: Italiaans pastagerecht waarin bucatini gecombineerd wordt met een saus van gekookte broccoli. De saus wordt op smaak gebracht door ansjovis, chili peper en knoflook te bakken, waarna tomatenpuree en het kookvocht van de broccoli worden toegevoegd. De broccoli wordt vervolgens geprakt en gemengd met de pasta. Het gerecht wordt vaak afgewerkt met geroosterd broodkruim, dat dient als een alternatief voor kaas.
broccoli-bucatini.content:
- Basissaus
	- Gekookte Broccoli
- Start
	- Ansjovis en chili pepper - bakken met stuk knoflook
	- Tomato paste
	- Kookvocht broccoli
	- Broccoli toevoegen, prakken
- Pasta
	- Bucatini (loved in Sicilia)
- Afmakers
	- Toasted breadcumbs (soort kaas alternatief)
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wCDKnMwPQEk

broccoli-calabria.title: Broccoli Calabria
broccoli-calabria.intro:
Broccoli Calabria is een pastagerecht dat zijn oorsprong vindt in de Italiaanse regio Calabrië. Het gerecht combineert trofie pasta met een saus van gekookte broccoli, kikkererwten, chili pepers en cherrytomaten. De broccoli wordt eerst gekookt en vervolgens geprakt in de saus, terwijl de kikkererwten heel blijven. Chili pepers worden in olie gebakken om de saus een pittig karakter te geven. Dit gerecht benut de typische ingrediënten en smaken van het zuiden van Italië.

- Basissaus
	- Gekookte Broccoli
- Start
	- Chili pepper bakken in olie
	- Cherry tomatoes en kikkererwten toevoegen, laten koken
	- Broccoli kookvocht toevoegen
	- Broccoli toevoegen en prakken (kikkererwten heel laten)
- Pasta
	- Trofie
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wCDKnMwPQEk

broccoli-campania.title: Broccoli Campania
broccoli-campania.intro:
Dit gerecht uit Campania kenmerkt zich door de combinatie van spaghetti met een saus van fijngemalen gekookte broccoli. De broccoli wordt in olie en knoflook geprakt tot een smeuïge saus, verrijkt met Italiaanse vissaus voor een umami smaak. Parmigiano Reggiano voegt een nootachtige diepte toe en het broccoli kookwater wordt gebruikt om de saus de juiste consistentie te geven. Het resultaat is een gerecht dat zowel eenvoudig als voedzaam is, typerend voor de keuken van de regio Campania.

- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wCDKnMwPQEk
- Basissaus
	- Gekookte broccoli
- Pasta
	- Spaghetti
- Afmakers
	- Broccoli in olie met knoflook fijnprakken
	- Italian fish sauce
	- Parmigiano Reggiano
	- Broccoli kookwater

broccoli-peperoni-cruschi.title: Broccoli Peperoni Cruschi
broccoli-peperoni-cruschi.intro:
Dit gerecht combineert casareccia pasta met een saus van gekookte broccoli en peperoni cruschi, een specifieke bereidingswijze van gedroogde rode pepers uit de regio Basilicata in Zuid-Italië. De pepers worden in olie gebakken samen met knoflook, waarna de broccoli wordt toegevoegd en geprakt tot een basissaus. Casareccia, een pasta met een gerolde vorm die lijkt op een klein, gerimpeld dekbed, is typisch voor deze streek en past goed bij robuuste sauzen.

- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wCDKnMwPQEk
- Basissaus
	- Gekookte Broccoli
- Start
	- Gedroogde pepers bakken in olie en teen knoflook (_Peperoni cruschi_)
	- Broccoli toevoegen en prakken
- Pasta
	- Casareccia

sauce: jar roasted red bell peppers, drained

creamy-red-peppers.title: Creamy Red Peppers
creamy-red-peppers.intro: Roasted red, yellow, or green bell peppers combined with Parmigiano cheese and cream create a colorful and flavorful pasta topping.

fusilli-primavera.title: Fusilli Primavera
fusilli-primavera.intro: This sauce is typically made with a variety of sautéed seasonal vegetables like bell peppers, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, and broccoli, all mixed with grated Parmigiano cheese.

fusilli-zucchini.title: Fusilli Zucchini
fusilli-zucchini.intro: Sauté zucchini and cherry tomatoes in olive oil, then mix in Parmigiano cheese for a light and fresh pasta sauce.

pasta-spinazie-gorgonzola.title: Radiatori Spinaci Gorgonzola
pasta-spinazie-gorgonzola.intro: Radiatori Spinaci Gorgonzola is a pasta dish that combines radiatori pasta with a rich, creamy Gorgonzola sauce, spinach, and a hint of garlic. Gorgonzola, a famous blue cheese from the Lombardy region of Italy, adds sharp and tangy notes, balanced by the light cooking cream. Spinach, introduced to Italian cuisine in the Middle Ages, brings a fresh, earthy touch, while walnuts add crunch. The radiatori shape, designed in the 20th century to hold sauces well, makes it ideal for this dish. A sprinkle of Parmigiano Reggiano completes the flavors, making it popular in modern Italian and international kitchens.
pasta-spinazie-gorgonzola.content:
- 100g pasta
- 50g Gorgonzola Picante
- 200g spinach (chopped)
- clove of garlic
- handful of walnuts
- oat cream
- Parmigiano Reggiano (for garnish)

## Pasta shape

- Radiatori (catches finely chopped spinach well)
- Conchiglioni or Mafaldine for a more festive version

penne-all-arrabbiata.title: Penne all'Arrabbiata
penne-all-arrabbiata.intro: Penne all'Arrabbiata is a simple, spicy Italian pasta dish that originates from the Lazio region, particularly Rome. The dish consists of penne cooked in a sauce made from tomatoes, garlic, and chili peppers (or hot pepper sauce). The name "arrabbiata" means "angry" in Italian, referring to the fiery and spicy flavor of the sauce. Traditionally, this dish is served without cheese, to preserve the boldness of the spicy tomato sauce. It exemplifies the Italian culinary philosophy of using a few ingredients to create a dish with strong, distinct flavors.
penne-all-arrabbiata.content:
- 100g penne
- Garlic
- Fresh chilies (or hot pepper sauce)
- 100g tomato (good quality peeled tomatoes, the best you can find - puree them)
- Parsley
- Traditionally, no cheese is added to Penne all'Arrabbiata, but if you prefer, you can top it with pecorino before serving

pesto-pancetta.title: Pesto pancetta
pesto-pancetta.intro:
- Pasta koken
- Uitje + knoflook + spekjes bakken
- Tomaat toevoegen (door de helft of kleiner)
- Pasta erdoor bakken
- Vuur uit en pesto erdoor roeren

pizza.title: Pizza
pizza.intro:
## Pizza Rosso

- **Pepperoni:** passata, mozzarella, pepperoni 🍔🍔
- **Diavola:** passata, mozzarella, spicy salami, rode pepers 🍔🍔

## Pizza Bianca

rag-di-lenticchie.title: Ragù di Lenticchie
rag-di-lenticchie.intro: This lentil Bolognese is a modern, plant-based twist on the traditional _ragù alla Bolognese_ from Italy’s Emilia-Romagna region. While classic Bolognese requires several hours to simmer and develop its rich flavors, this version, using lentils as a protein-packed substitute for meat, needs only 30-45 minutes to cook. Lentils, unlike meat, can become too soft if cooked too long, making this dish a quicker alternative. Popular among vegetarians and vegans across Europe, it is often served with pasta for dinner. Oat cream adds a smooth texture, keeping the dish entirely plant-based yet satisfying.
rag-di-lenticchie.content:
- To prepare, cook the lentils separately for 10-15 minutes (this helps the flavors blend well)
- Soffritto; sauté in olive oil:
	- yellow onion
	- 100g finely chopped carrots
	- 100g finely chopped celery
- Add to soffritto and let boil for 30-45 min:
	- 200g lentils (green or brown, cooked)
	- 400ml passata (tomato purée)
	- Thyme and/or oregano (add early so it has time to release maximum flavor)
	- 2 tablespoons of tomato paste (or more, if you like)
	- 150-200ml oat cream
	- 3 tablespoons nutritional yeast (for extra umami)
	- Salt, pepper, and optionally a pinch of nutmeg
- Serve with penne or tagliatelle
	- Contrary to popular belief, just like with Bolognese, don’t serve this sauce with spaghetti. This kind of sauce doesn’t stick to spaghetti as well.

spinach-corti-bucati.title: Spinach Corti Bucati
spinach-corti-bucati.intro:
This creamy sauce includes spinach, artichoke hearts, and Parmigiano cheese for a delicious and nutritious pasta dish.

- Kook de fusilli tot laatste 2 min
	- Pasta wegzetten, 1 kop pasta water bewaren
	- Hierna boter toevoegen en sun dried tomatoes
	- Hierna gesneden spinazie doorroeren
	- Mascarpone toevoegen
	- Helft van de kaas toevoegen
	- Pasta toevoegen
	- Andere helft van de kaas bovenop
- 5 min grillen
- Kaas mix:
	- Gruyere
	- Parmigiano Reggiano

[One Pot Spinach Artichoke Pasta With Four Cheeses - DeLallo](https://www.delallo.com/recipe/one-pot-spinach-artichoke-pasta-with-four-cheeses/)

twisted-spinach-pesto.title: Twisted Spinach Pesto
twisted-spinach-pesto.intro: Combine sundried tomatoes, fresh spinach, Parmigiano cheese, and pine nuts in a food processor to make a vibrant pesto sauce.
